name: Kenneth A. Ross
content: Home Page for Kenneth Ross Kenneth Ross. Kenneth Ross is a Professor in the Computer Science Department at Columbia University in New York City. His research interests touch on various aspects of database systems, including query processing, query language design, data warehousing, and architecture-sensitive database system design.  He also has an interest in computational biology, including the analysis of large genomic data sets. Professor Ross received his PhD from Stanford University.  He has received several awards, including a Packard Foundation Fellowship, a Sloan Foundation Fellowship, and an NSF Young Investigator award. Research. Database Research Lab. Publications. Press. Teaching. Student Advising. Novelty picture. Big Data White Paper. Home page of Sylvia Schwartz. Ken Ross / kar@cs.columbia.edu
